snippet: In a point-by-point rejection of the West’s version of the conflict in Syria, the Syrian foreign minister likened the “devastations of terrorism” in Syria and the United States.
abstract: Walid al-Moallem, Syrian foreign minister, equates his country's brutal conflict to the Sept 11 attacks and accuses the United States of hypocrisy during a speech at the United Nations General Assembly; Moallem's statement, which is an attempt to rebut Syria's political opposition and its outside supporters, is denounced by the United States.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and SOMINI SENGUPTA

lead_paragraph: In a point-by-point rejection of the West’s version of the conflict in Syria, the Syrian foreign minister likened the “devastations of terrorism” in Syria and the United States.

headline.main: Invoking Sept. 11, Syrian Accuses U.S. of Hypocrisy
headline.print_headline: Invoking Sept. 11, Syrian Accuses U.S. of Hypocrisy

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
